content.question: Consider a 95 percent confidence interval constructed for the difference between two population proportions <math alttext="p sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="p sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The interval for <math alttext="p sub R minus p sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is given as <math alttext="negative 0.05 comma 0.15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.05</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0.15</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is an appropriate interpretation of the confidence level?

choices.label: In repeated random sampling with the same sample size, <math alttext="p hat sub R minus p hat sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be contained in the interval approximately 95 percent of the time.

In repeated random sampling with the same sample size, <math alttext="p sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be contained in the interval approximately 95 percent of the time.

In repeated random sampling with the same sample size, <math alttext="p hat sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be contained in the interval approximately 95 percent of the time.

The probability is 0.95 that the difference in the sample proportions <math alttext="p hat sub R minus p hat sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is between <math alttext="negative 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and 0.15.

In repeated random sampling with the same sample size, approximately 95 percent of the intervals will capture the difference in population proportions, <math alttext="p sub R minus p sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: In repeated random sampling with the same sample size, approximately 95 percent of the intervals will capture the difference in population proportions, <math alttext="p sub R minus p sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 6.9: Justifying a Claim Based on a Confidence Interval for a Difference Between Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
